business.headline: How Gen-Z is changing money habits, explains financial advisorGen-Z is shaking up traditional money habits. From saving to investing and spending on experiences, this generation is rewriting the rules of wealth. A financial advisor explains how and why.

Can GST relief on insurance turn first-time buyers into long-term policyholders?For millions of families who hesitated to buy insurance because of the extra tax burden, the recent GST reforms could be a turning point.

ITR 2025 deadline: Know penalties and benefits you lose for missing the due dateThe deadline to file Income Tax Returns (ITR) for 2025 is here, and missing it can cost more than just a late fee. From penalties to lost tax perks, here's what you need to know.

Advance tax deadline today: How much to pay and penalty for delayThe second instalment of advance tax for financial year 2026 is due on 15 September. Here's what individuals need to pay, who is liable, and the consequences of missing the deadline.

Tax reforms for rising Bharat: GST 2.0 big win for citizens, says Nirmala SitharamanThe Union Finance Minister said that GST reforms will be implemented much ahead of Prime Minister Narendra Modi's instructions of launching them before Deepavali festival.

Potholes cost lives and money: How citizens can file for compensation in IndiaBeyond the headlines of tragedy lies a fundamental question that haunts every Indian who has suffered at the hands of negligent road maintenance: Can we actually hold the government accountable for these losses?

Scrapping 97 lakh unfit vehicles can fetch Rs 40,000 crore GST, says Nitin GadkariSpeaking at a recent event, Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said large-scale scrappage of unfit and polluting vehicles could create jobs, boost demand and cut costs, while giving the Centre and states a major GST windfall.

Retire before 50? Here's how to turn that dream into realityWant to hang up your boots before 50? It's not just for billionaires. With deliberate choices, a strong savings habit, and careful planning, financial freedom can come decades earlier than most people imagine.

Only two days left: Why you should file ITR even if you earn under Rs 12 lakhWith two days left for FY 2024-25 ITR filing, experts stress the importance of filing for those earning under Rs 12 lakh. Neglecting this can lead to notices and penalties from the Income Tax Department.

FMCG firms say can't lower MRPs on Rs 5, 10, 20 packs despite GST cut: ReportInstead, companies said they will keep the same price but increase the quantity inside the pack. For example, a Rs 20 biscuit pack could now contain more grams of biscuits for the same price.

Sebi reclassifies REITs as equity: What it means for MFs and investorsAs part of amendments to the Sebi (Mutual Funds) Regulations, 1996, REITs will now be reclassified as "equity" instruments, while InvITs will continue to be treated as "hybrid" products. Read to know what it means for investors.

Sebi eases IPO norms for large firms: What it means for investorsUnder the revised norms, companies with post-issue market capital above Rs 1 lakh crore can gradually increase public shareholding to 25%. If public shareholding is below 15% at listing, it must rise to 15% within five years and to 25% within ten years.

Save up to Rs 2 lakh a year: Real estate tax hacks every investor should knowFor many Indians, property isn't just a place to live, it's a smart investment. But what often gets overlooked are the tax breaks that can make real estate even more rewarding.
Retail inflation rises marginally to 2.07% in August from 1.55% in JulyDespite edging up in August, inflation remains very low compared to recent years and well within the RBI's target range of 2–6%.

Sebi board meeting decisions in focus as markets rally for eighth straight sessionBut the bigger story now is what comes next from Sebi. The regulator's crucial board meeting is expected to decide on sweeping changes to futures and options trading.
Sensex closes 356 points higher, Nifty above 25,100; BEL gains 4%The S&P BSE Sensex added 356 points to close at 81,904.70, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 108.50 points to end at 25,114.00.

Gen-Z vs millennial: Who is better at saving money?GenZ are painted as loud, brash spenders who splurge on gadgets, sneakers, and experiences over savings. But is that really true when it comes to accumulating savings?

Sebi meeting today: What can stock market investors expect from meeting?The Securities and Exchange Board of India (Sebi) is expected to approve a set of reforms that aim to make the market more attractive for businesses and investors.

Giorgio Armani's will outlines gradual sale or IPO of fashion empireThe late Giorgio Armani has left behind more than just a fashion empire. His will reveals a carefully crafted plan for the future of his company. Here's what it says.

Gold hits record highs. 3 key reasons behind the rallyThe shine of gold is brighter than ever. Prices have soared to record levels, with global and domestic markets witnessing a strong rally. So, what's driving this rise? Three major factors are at play.

How seniors can unlock Rs 1.5 lakh a month from their home, explains expertRising medical bills and everyday expenses often strain retirees who have no pension. But for those who own a house, there's a way out. An expert says reverse mortgage can turn property into a monthly pension of Rs 1.5 lakh.

From income reporting to form selection: 7 must-do ITR stepsThis article outlines the key things taxpayers in India need to remember while filing their income tax return for the current assessment year, with a focus on accuracy, compliance, and timely processing.

Infosys shares up 2% on record buyback plan. Will existing shareholders benefit?Infosys shares climbed over 2% after the IT firm announced a Rs 18,000 crore buyback, the largest in its history. The offer, priced at a 19% premium, could benefit existing shareholders, though experts caution on execution challenges.

Thinking of borrowing for your next foreign trip? Here's why you shouldn'tA surge in Indians borrowing for foreign trips raises financial concerns. CoinSwitch's founder offers insights into prudent financial practices to prevent potential debt accumulation.

Explained: Why SIP investors on trading apps must check XIRR, not just returnsIn SIPs, investments enter the market at different times. Some stay for years, others only months. Absolute returns treat them alike, distorting the picture. XIRR offers a more accurate measure.

Urban Company IPO closes today. Is it a risky bet as GMP soars on last day?Urban Company's initial public offering ends its bidding phase today after strong investor interest and rising grey market premiums.

Gold touches new lifetime high of Rs 1.13 lakh per 10 grams in DelhiGold prices surged to a new lifetime high of Rs 1,13,100 per 10 grams in Delhi on Thursday. Zupee lays off 30% of staff as it adapts to India's Online Gaming ActZupee has rolled out a comprehensive relief package for employees affected by the layoffs. The support plan includes financial assistance beyond the standard notice period, with extra compensation based on years of service.

Rupee slides to all-time low as US tariffs biteThe Indian rupee hit a record low of 88.44 against the US dollar on Thursday, pressured by US tariffs and heavy foreign investor outflows.

UPS to NPS switch now allowed, but rules applyCentral government employees who opted for the UPS can now switch back to the NPS, the government has announced. However, this flexibility comes with specific rules and conditions that employees must follow.

entertainment.headline: Kichcha Sudeep will appear in a cameo in KD The Devil, makers confirmKannada star Kichcha Sudeep will be seen in a guest appearance in the upcoming film 'KD: The Devil', which stars Dhruva Sarja and Sanjay Dutt. The film, directed by Prem, features an ensemble cast and the announcement was made by KVN Productions onsocial media.

Too Much trailer: Kajol, Twinkle Khanna bring Bollywood's wild side backAre you ready for another celebrity chat show? If yes, then 'Too Much with Kajol and Twinkle Khanna' should be on your watchlist. Here's why?

Selena Gomez upset as Only Murders in the Building gets Emmy 2025 snubSelena Gomez made her first red carpet appearance with fiance Benny Blanco at the 2025 Emmys. The couple shared sweet moments as her show missed out on a win.

Mirai actor Teja Sajja names SRK as dream collaborator, discusses new projectTelugu actor Teja Sajja expressed interest in Hindi cinema while choosing to stay based in Hyderabad. In an exclusive interview with India Today, he praised dubbed films and hopes to work with Shah Rukh Khan in future projects.

Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari trailer: Pyaar Toh Hona Hi Tha ft. Varun-Janhvi'Sunny Sanskari Ki Tulsi Kumari' trailer: Varun Dhawan and Janhvi Kapoor shine in Shashank Khaitan's coluorful rom-com, but it seems like a modern twist reminiscent of the 1998 'Pyaar Toh Hona Hi Tha'.

Can't compare apples and oranges: Ameesha Patel on Saiyaara vs Kaho Naa Pyaar HaiAmeesha Patel praised Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda's film 'Saiyaara' but said it should not be compared to her debut 'Kaho Naa Pyaar Hai', as both are very different. She added that Bollywood needs fresh faces and was happy to see Gen Z connect with 'Saiyaara'.

Bigg Boss 19 Weekend Ka Vaar: Baseer-Nehal end friendship amid romance rumoursBaseer Ali and Nehal Chudasama, one of the most talked-about pairs on 'Bigg Boss 19',  are no longer friends. The duo announced the end of their friendship on Weekend Ka Vaar, which was hosted by the 'Jolly LLB 3' team and Farah Khan.

After Abhishek-Aishwarya, KJo files plea for protection of his personality rightsFilmmaker Karan Johar has filed a petition in the Delhi High Court seeking protection of his personality rights. The development follows similar legal actions by Aishwarya Rai and Abhishek Bachchan, raising concerns over name misuse.

Disha Patani's sister Khushboo shares self-defence video days after firing incidentAfter a firing incident outside actor Disha Patani's Bareilly home, retired Army Major Khushboo Patani shared a self-defence video, demonstrating how simple items can be used for safety.

Ram Gopal Varma on Mirai: VFX Outshines Rs 400 crore films, action-like ritualsTeja Sajja's superhero film 'Mirai' is making waves at the box office, winning appreciation for its visuals, storyline, and VFX. Filmmaker Ram Gopal Varma praised the film's effects, noting they surpassed those of several higher-budget projects.

Soha Ali Khan recalls being flashed in Italy: Apparently that happens oftenActor Soha Ali Khan shared that she was flashed in broad daylight during a trip to Italy, calling the incident disturbing. She also reflected on how her privileged background shielded her from many unsafe situations and even the casting couch in Bollywood.

Demon Slayer Infinity Castle box office Day 3: India records staggering 1st weekend'Demon Slayer: Infinity Castle' shattered records in India with a historic Rs 41 crore opening weekend, becoming the biggest non-Hollywood foreign film. The Japanese anime blockbuster is also breaking box office records worldwide.

Mariska Hargitay, Christopher Meloni reunite with Law & Order: SVU castThe stars of 'Law and Order: SVU' reunited at the 77th Emmy Awards on 14 September 2025, presenting the Outstanding Drama Series award and celebrating 35 years of the iconic franchise with light-hearted banter and tributes.

Tempest review: Jun Ji-hyun and Gang Dong-won headline a taut political spy dramaRelease Date:Wed Sep 10, 2025'Tempest' review: 'Tempest' is a political thriller focusing on a diplomat's wife navigating betrayal after an assassination. The series explores complex geopolitics and personal survival amid rising tensions.

Upendra, wife's phone hacked, actor urges contacts not to transfer moneyKannada actor-director Upendra announced on his Instagram stories that a hacker may have hacked his and his wife Priyanka's phones. The two urged their contacts not to respond to the hacker's money requests.

Sofia Vergara skips Emmys 2025 after sudden eye allergy emergencySofía Vergara faced an unexpected eye emergency just hours before the 2025 Emmys, leading to her hospitalisation and absence from the event. Despite her setback, the ceremony saw memorable wins and historic moments, making it a night to cherish.

Aamir Khan hasn't seen Coolie yet: Actor's team denies criticising Rajinikanth filmAamir Khan Productions has issued a clarification, refuting fake news attributing remarks to Aamir Khan about the film Coolie. A doctored news clip claiming that Khan regretted signing the Rajinikanth-starrer had been going viral.

Nobody Wants This 2: When and where to watch Adam Brody, Kristen Bell's show'Nobody Wants This' is returning for a second season this October, delighting fans who loved its honest take on relationships and emotional struggles. The new season is set to dive deeper into themes of love, family, and self-discovery, with its release in October.

Kannada cinema 2025: Missing superstars, one Rs 100-crore hit and what lies aheadNine months in, Kannada cinema this year have mostly been about the little guy's shot at triumph. While some films gained attention, it has only been 'Su From So' that truly left a mark.

general news.headline: BMW driver took my husband to hospital 19 km away despite appeals: Victim's wifeThe victim, Navjot Singh, Deputy Secretary in the Department of Economic Affairs, was returning from Bangla Sahib Gurdwara with his wife Sandeep Kaur on Sunday afternoon when their motorcycle was hit by a speeding BMW near Dhaula Kuan on Ring Road.

Supreme Court partly pauses Waqf Act as it prepares to hear pleas against itOn May 22, the Supreme Court reserved its interim order on the Act after arguments from the two sides for three straight days. The petitions filed challenge the constitutionality of the changes made to the Waqf law by amendments passed by Parliament earlier this year.

Boycott or not, few really care about India vs Pakistan anymoreAsia Cup 2025: Boycott or not, the India vs Pakistan rivalry is losing its edge. Once fiery underdogs, Pakistan now offer little resistance, and Sunday's defeat was yet another reminder that the contest is increasingly one-sided.

New Pixel and iPhone are here, so is the beginning of an end for smartphonesAfter close to 20 years of glorious run, smartphones as technology have become stagnant and are ripe to be replaced with something else. At least that is the impression the latest Google Pixels and Apple iPhones offer given how incremental they are with their updates.

Why would anyone convert if Hinduism had equality: Siddaramaiah's remarks draw ireKarnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah's remark on Hinduism and conversions triggered a political storm, with Opposition leaders, including R Ashoka and Chalavadi Narayanswamy, accusing him of dividing communities and pursuing political gains.

Did what felt right: Man who took BMW crash victim, his wife to hospital 19 km awayNavjot Singh, a senior Finance Ministry official, died after a speeding BMW driven by a woman hit his motorcycle near Delhi Cantonment area on Sunday night.

How loyalty, temptation stumped boycott as India clashed with PakDid Indians actually boycott Sunday's India-Pakistan T20 Asia Cup match? Though hashtags calling people to not watch the match trended, anecdotal evidence suggests otherwise. As Indians blamed the government and the BCCI for the match with Pakistan, they backed the Men in Blue and gave in to the temptation of watching a superior India team send Pakistanis packing.

Tied, beaten, genitals stapled: Kerala couple arrested for torturing, robbing 2 menA Kerala couple allegedly tortured two men, forcing sexual acts, stapling their bodies and pepper-spraying genitals. They filmed one assault and robbed both victims. Police arrested them and are probing possible black-magic motives.

UK man arrested over racially motivated rape of Sikh womanPolice said the man, in his 30s, was detained on Sunday and remains in custody as part of their enquiries into the "racially motivated rape" in Oldbury, West Midlands region of England, reported last Tuesday.

Furious at wife over birthday party video, man shoots her dead on Gwalior streetA man in Gwalior shot his wife dead in broad daylight after seeing her Facebook birthday party video with a friend. The accused, Arvind Parihar, was arrested after pointing a pistol at police officers.

Caught on CCTV: Brave nurses in Assam hospital shield babies during strong quakeThe CCTV footage was captured at around 4.40 pm in the Aditya Nursing Home, Nagaon, showing the two nurses immediately coming to the aid of the babies as the earthquake struck.

Pakistan lodge protest against India players, match referee over handshake rowThe Pakistan cricket team has launched a formal protest against the Indian players for refusing to shake hands at the end of the match. The team has reportedly also lodged a complaint against the match referee Andy Pycroft.

Indians in UK are patriotic: British journalist's viral post amid anti-immigration stirBritish journalist Andrew Gold wrote about his encounter with an Indian restaurant owner, which led him to say that Indians in the UK are patriotic. The post comes after London witnessed its largest-ever protests against immigration.

Nothing wrong with transfer of temple elephants: Big top court relief for VantaraGiving Vantara a clean chit, the Supreme Court said that the transfer of temple elephants to Reliance Foundation's animal rescue and conservation center in Gujarat's Jamnagar is valid as long as due procedure is followed.
Proof you're a true 90s kid: You read this in the 'Washing Powder Nirma' tuneCadbury once made us dance on cricket pitches; today's ads barely make us pause the scroll.

Protests as Sikh woman, 73, detained by immigration officials after 30 years in USA 73-year-old Sikh woman, Harjit Kaur, was detained by US immigration authorities in California during a routine check-in, sparking protests from her family and community.

Bengaluru official's video with Canadian vlogger after road cleanup sparks outrageThat it took a foreign national to spotlight Bengaluru's crumbling pedestrian infrastructure has sparked outrage on social media.

Is your partner a serial spender? Here's how to help (without starting World War III)It's not out of the blue to have problems with your partner when it comes to money, but here's a better way to sort it than just taking digs at them.
Massive asteroid bigger than Qutub Minar flying towards EarthFA22 follows a moderately elongated, slightly tilted orbit around the sun, with an orbital period of roughly 1.85 years.

Rishabh Pant no longer in cast, walking comfortably after foot fracture: ReportRishabh Pant has made significant strides in his recovery. The wicketkeeper-batter no longer needs a cast and is walking comfortably. He is expected to travel to the BCCI's Centre of Excellence to begin training as he eyes a return in the West Indies home series.

Asia Cup 2025: How Pakistan reacted to India's handshake snubIndia refused to shake hands with Pakistan after their tense Asia Cup match. This has sparked criticism from former Pakistani cricketers and raised questions on sportsmanship amid political tensions.

Boycott or not, few really care about India vs Pakistan anymoreAsia Cup 2025: Boycott or not, the India vs Pakistan rivalry is losing its edge. Once fiery underdogs, Pakistan now offer little resistance, and Sunday's defeat was yet another reminder that the contest is increasingly one-sided.

Pakistan launches formal protest against India players over handshake snubPakistan has lodged a protest with the Asian Cricket Council after Indian cricket players did not shake hands with their opponents following an Asia Cup match. The Indian captain, Surya Kumar Yadav, who led the team to victory, chose to forgo the post-match custom. Speaking after the game, Yadav dedicated the win to the victims of the Pahalgam terror attacks and the armed forces. He said, "We stand by with the victims of the families of Pehelgam terror attack and we express our solidarity... we want to dedicate today's win to all our armed forces who showed a lot of bravery." The gesture is being seen as a message of solidarity from the Indian team. The complaint by Pakistan comes after a match where the Indian team dominated in all departments.

UAE, Oman desperate for redemption after nightmare startsUAE and Oman face a do-or-die Group A match in the Asia Cup 2025 after heavy losses to India and Pakistan, with both teams needing a win to stay in the tournament. The Abu Dhabi pitch offers balanced conditions, promising a competitive contest as both sides seek redemption.

Ruben Amorim backs philosophy despite Manchester United's 3-0 thrashing to CityRuben Amorim stood firm on his football philosophy despite Manchester United's disastrous start, including a 3-0 derby defeat to City. As results worsen, pressure mounts on INEOS to decide whether to back or sack him.

After handshake snub, Pakistan captain skips post-match presentation ceremonyAsia Cup 2025: Pakistan captain Salman Agha skipped the post-match presentation following his team's loss to India in Dubai on Sunday, after Indian captain Suryakumar Yadav avoided the customary pre-match handshake.

Suryakumar dedicates India's win over Pakistan to Pahalgam victims, armed forcesAsia Cup 2025: India captain Suryakumar Yadav said the cricket team stood with the victims of the terror attack in Pahalgam and dedicated their dominant win over Pakistan to the armed forces.

Same old story: India crush listless Pakistan in clash of unequals at Asia CupAsia Cup: India hammered Pakistan by seven wickets in an one-sided affair in Dubai on Sunday. Pakistan lacked tactical nous as Indian spinners ran riot, exposing the gulf in class between the two teams.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
